intro: Lacunaria crenata subsp. crenata, commonly known as the serrated lacunaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to parts of eastern Asia, including Japan and China. The plant is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. Its leaves are typically lobed and have a serrated margin, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal.
